bibl.title: Private Portraits and Public Personae in Late Antique Egypt.
bibl.note: Abstract of a paper presented at the 94th Annual Meeting of the Archaeological Institute of America. - The portraits of deified mortals evoked social status and stage of life by a specific vocabulary of motifs.
bibl.seg: THOMAS Thelma K., Private Portraits and Public Personae in Late Antique Egypt.

Abstract of a paper presented at the 94th Annual Meeting of the Archaeological Institute of America. - The portraits of deified mortals evoked social status and stage of life by a specific vocabulary of motifs.
